summary: The 'One Flag for All Act' prohibits the display of any flag other than the U.S. flag on or in covered public buildings, including federal buildings, military installations, and embassies. Exceptions are made for specific flags, such as those representing POW/MIAs, visiting diplomats, members of Congress, branches of the Armed Forces, flags of historical significance, and flags representing public safety or special national observances. The bill aims to establish a clear standard for flag display on federal property.
